bwwExcerpt: People may be clawing their way into "The Merchant of Venice" to look deep into the thousand-year-old-eyes of Al Pacino's harrowing, yet beautifully restrained Shylock on Broadway. And rightly so. But what theatergoers will also experience - call it collateral advantage - is one of the most gripping, haunting and lucid examples of that elusive, often maligned ideal, American Shakespeare without...
